title: How to Make Cinnamon Bun Bread

steps.headline: Lightly grease an 8x8 inch (20cm) square baking pan.
steps.description: Use margarine or    non-stick cooking spray.

steps.headline: Mix the flour, sugar, and salt in a large bowl.
Combine the warmed milk and yeast in a measuring cup.
Add the yeast-milk mixture, egg, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract to the flour mixture.
Pour the mixture into the baking pan.
steps.description: Set aside for at least 15 minutes.

steps.headline: Make the topping.
steps.description: Stir together the brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon together until you have a crumbly mixture.

steps.headline: Sprinkle the topping over the pan mixture.
steps.description: You can either swirl it in or lightly press it down.

steps.headline: Place the pan in the cold oven.
steps.description: You'll be baking it while the oven is preheating. Bake the mixture for 30 minutes at 350ºF/180ºC.

steps.headline: Check for doneness.
steps.description: The cinnamon bread should spring back when lightly pressed. Set aside to cool for 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Make the icing by whisking the milk and powdered sugar together.
steps.description: Drizzle the icing on top of the bread.

steps.headline: Serve the cinnamon bread warm.
steps.description: Any leftovers can also be reheated in the microwave for a few seconds.

text: Lightly grease an 8x8 inch (20cm) square baking pan. Use margarine or    non-stick cooking spray. Mix the flour, sugar, and salt in a large bowl.  Combine the warmed milk and yeast in a measuring cup. Dissolve the yeast completely. Add the yeast-milk mixture, egg, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract to the flour mixture. Mix together thoroughly. Pour the mixture into the baking pan. Set aside for at least 15 minutes. Make the topping. Stir together the brown sugar, butter, and cinnamon together until you have a crumbly mixture. Sprinkle the topping over the pan mixture. You can either swirl it in or lightly press it down. Place the pan in the cold oven. You'll be baking it while the oven is preheating. Bake the mixture for 30 minutes at 350ºF/180ºC. Check for doneness. The cinnamon bread should spring back when lightly pressed. Set aside to cool for 30 minutes. Make the icing by whisking the milk and powdered sugar together. Drizzle the icing on top of the bread. Serve the cinnamon bread warm. Any leftovers can also be reheated in the microwave for a few seconds.
